styles.name: Abstract art
styles.description: Characterized by the use of geometric shapes, lines, and colors to create compositions that do not represent specific objects or scenes.

styles.name: Realism
styles.description: Seeks to accurately depict the world as it appears in reality.

styles.name: Impressionism
styles.description: Characterized by the use of loose brushstrokes and a focus on the effects of light on objects.

styles.name: Expressionism
styles.description: Emphasizes the emotions and inner states of the artist, often using distorted or exaggerated forms to convey these feelings.

styles.name: Surrealism
styles.description: Seeks to express the unconscious mind through dreamlike imagery and unexpected combinations of objects and elements.

styles.name: Pop art
styles.description: Incorporates elements of popular culture and mass media into the artwork.

styles.name: Minimalism
styles.description: Characterized by the use of simple, geometric forms and a focus on essential elements.

styles.name: Futurism
styles.description: Celebrates the machines and technology of the modern world, often depicting scenes of speed and motion.

styles.name: Cubism
styles.description: Characterized by the use of geometric shapes and the fragmentation of objects into geometric forms.

styles.name: Fauvism
styles.description: Characterized by the use of bold, bright colors and the distortion of form for expressive effect
